info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 15 at 3:53PM EDT until August 15 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN CATAWBA...SOUTHEASTERN MCDOWELL...NORTHEASTERN RUTHERFORD...NORTHWESTERN LINCOLN...NORTHWESTERN CLEVELAND AND SOUTHERN BURKE COUNTIES... At 352 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles southwest of Hickory to 6 miles southwest of Morganton to 8 miles south of Marion, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Valdese, Spindale, Maiden, Icard, Hildebran, Connelly Springs, Rutherford College, Belwood, Bostic and Casar. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
